definitions.definition: hard enough to be broken easily
used to describe cooked foods, such as pastry and biscuits, that are well cooked so that they are just dry and hard enough
Crisp fruit or vegetables are fresh and firm:
Crisp paper or cloth is stiff and smooth:
examples: a crisp new £5 note/a crisp white tablecloth

definitions.definition: a very thin, often round piece of fried potato, sometimes with a flavour added, sold especially in plastic bags:
examples: a packet of salt and vinegar crisps
